alert.note: Alert for Jones (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 29 at 10:44PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, Jones. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1041 PM CDT, radar indicated showers and thunderstorms with heavy rain across the western half of Jones County, moving very slowly east at 10 mph. Rainfall of 1 to 2 inches has already fallen, and additional rainfall of around one inch is expected. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Anson, Hamlin, Hawley, Neinda, Noodle, The Intersection Of Us-180 And Ranch Road 126, Truby, Hodges, Tuxedo and Stith. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... CO Rd. 444 crossing Noodle Creek, crossings along County Road 141 and County Road 260 crossing Harmony Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
